pull.title: cluster mempool: add TxGraph work controls
pull.body:
Part of #30289. Builds on top of #31553.

So far, the `TxGraph::DoWork()` function took no parameters, and just made all clusters reach the "acceptable" internal quality level by performing a minimum number of improvement iterations on it, but:
* Did not attempt to go beyond that.
* Was broken, as the QualityLevel of optimal clusters that merge together was not being reset.

Fix this by adding an argument to `DoWork()` to control how much work it is allowed to do right now, which will first be used to get all clusters to the acceptable level, and if more budget remains, use it to try to get some or all clusters optimal. The function will now return `true` if all clusters are known to be optimal (and thus no further work remains). This is verified in the tests, by remembering whether the graph is optimal, and if it is at the end of the simulation run, verify that the overall linearization cannot be improved further.

events.message: txgraph: reset quality when merging clusters (bugfix)
txgraph: singleton split-off clusters are optimal (optimization)
txgraph: track amount of work done in linearization (preparation)
txgraph: make number of acceptable iterations configurable (feature)

txgraph: add work limit to DoWork(), try optimal (feature)

This adds an `iters` parameter to DoWork(), which controls how much work it is
allowed to do right now.

Additionally, DoWork() won't stop at just getting everything ACCEPTABLE, but if
there is work budget left, will also attempt to get every cluster linearized
optimally.

events.body: Rebased after the merge of #31553, and undrafted.

review through 18e40b6cd5a11e23b7a0654bdd12f08e610ce980

no big concerns on first pass

comments.body: nice, this should allow some non-optimals to finally be created :+1:
would this also be trivially true for `<=2`?

comment below says 

"// Make the graph linearize all clusters acceptably."

I'm guessing these chains are trivial to linearize, so this was likely already achieved with 10k iterations?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -247,7 +247,8 @@ class TxGraph
 
 /** Construct a new TxGraph with the specified limit on the number of transactions within a cluster,
  *  and on the sum of transaction sizes within a cluster. max_cluster_count cannot exceed
- *  MAX_CLUSTER_COUNT_LIMIT. */
-std::unique_ptr<TxGraph> MakeTxGraph(unsigned max_cluster_count, uint64_t max_cluster_size) noexcept;
+ *  MAX_CLUSTER_COUNT_LIMIT. acceptable_iters controls how many linearization optimization
+ *  steps will be performed before it is considered to be of acceptable quality. */
comments.body:
```Suggestion
* steps will be performed per cluster before it is considered to be of acceptable quality. */
```
would it be possible to assert that this must return true if the value is high enough since we have a limited txgraph size?
double-checking: NEEDS_RELINEARIZE, ACCEPTABLE and OPTIMAL are the only possible cases at this point, right?
